1.q_string: If A and B are two events of a random experiment such that P(A∪B)=45,P(A¯∪B¯)=710 and P(B)=25, then the value of P(A) equals?
If  PA∪B = 0.6 and PA∩B = 0.2 ,then the probability of exactly one of the event occurs is ?
From a group of 8 boys and girls, a committee of 5 members to be formed. Find the probability that 2 particular girls are included in committee?
The probability that the three cards drawn from the pack of 52 cards, are all black, is?
If events A, B are independent,PA` =23 and PB` = 27  then PA∩B is equal to?
If A and B are two events with PAc = 0.3, PB = 0.4 and PA∩Bc .Then PBA∩Bc  is equal to?
If A,B and C are mutually exclusive and exhaustive events of a random experiment such that PB=3/2 PA and PC = 1/2 PB,then PA∪C equals?
A dice is thrown three times. Getting a 3 or a 6 is considered success. Then the probability of at least two success is?
The minimum number of times a fair coin must be tossed so that the probability of getting at least one head is at least 0.8 is ?
A coin is tossed 2n times, then probability of getting one head more in the last n tosses as in the first n tosses is?

The probability of student A passing an examination 29 & of student B passing is 59. Assuming the two events. 'A passes', 'B passes' as independent. Then the probability of

(i) Only A passing the examination is ?

(ii) Only one of them passing the examination is ?
The probability that two persons have their same birthday is (considering year to be of 365 days)?
2n (n ≥ -8) people sit around a round table at random. Probability that two people A and B sit with six people between them is?
A fair coin in tossed a fixed number of times. If the probability of getting exactly 3 heads equals the probability of getting exactly 5 heads, then the probability of getting exactly one head is?
Given that the events A and B are independent, if PA' =23 and PB' = 27 ,then PA∩B is equal to?
In a leap year one day is chosen at random and is found to be a Sunday. What is the probability that the 366th day is a Sunday too?

In a lot of 12 microwave ovens, there are 3 defective units. A person has ordered 4 of these units and since each is identically packed, the selection will be random. what is the probability that at least 2 units are good?
The probability that a bulb produced by a factory will fuse after 150 days of use is 0.05.Find the probability out of 5 such bulbs not more than one will fuse after 150 days of use?
From a lot of 10 items containing 2 defective samples. A sample of 3 items is drawn at random. Find the probability that atmost 1 is defective?
If P(A) = 65, P(B) = 80, then PA∩B  lies in the interval?
The probability of bomb hitting a target is 1/3 .Two bombs are enough to destroy a bridge. If five bombs are dropped at the bridge. What is the probability that the bridge is destroyed?

A bag contain 2 white balls and 3 red balls, a bag B contains 4 white and 5 black balls. A bag is selected at random and a ball is drawn from it. Drawn ball is observed to be white. Find the probability that bag B is selected?

The pap test makes a correct diagnosis with probability 95% gives that the test is positive for a child, what is the probability that he really has the disease? Assume that one in every 2000 children, on average has the disease.
If two dice are tossed 6 times, then what is the probability that the sum of numbers obtained on the top is 7, in exactly four of the tosses?

In a bolt factory A, B, C manufactures 25%, 35%, 40% respectively. Of the total of their output 5%, 4% and 2% are defective. A bolt is drawn and is found to be defective. What are the probabilities that it was manufactured by the machines B, C? if the probability P(AE) =2569  & E  is the event of selecting a bolt?
A bag contains 4 red and 4 white balls. Three balls are drawn at random. The odd against these balls being all white will be?
A can solve 75 % of the problems of a book and B can solve 60 % of the problem of the same book. The probability that at least one can solve a problem of the book chosen at random, is?

1W, 2R, 3B balls

 2W, 3R, 1B balls

3W, 1R, 2B balls

An urn is chosen at random and from it two balls are drawn at random and are found to be "one red and one white". Then the probability that they came from the second urn, is?

q_option: Statement–1 is True, Statement–2 is True; Statement–2 is a correct explanation for Statement–1

1.q_string:
Let A and B be two event such that P(A∪B) ≥ 3/4 and 1/8 ≤ P(A∪B) ≤ 3/8

Statement–1: P(A)+P(B)≥7/8

Statement–2: P(A)+P(B)≤11/8
